title: Mathematical Modeling and Optimization for Deep Learning-Based COVID-19 Medical Imaging Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and substantial practical experience in specialized fields, foundational understanding of linear algebra, probability statistics, and optimization theory
context.additional_context: A blended structure combining smartphone-based online learning with weekly offline workshops. Utilizes mobile-friendly tools for medical imaging data analysis and applies mathematical concepts such as matrix operations and gradient-based optimization.

learning_goals: Explain the mathematical structure of CNN models (convolution operations, activation functions, loss functions, etc.) for feature extraction in COVID-19 CT/X-ray images
Apply statistical preprocessing and geometric augmentation techniques to medical imaging datasets to improve classification accuracy by ≥15%

Learners design lightweight deep learning models (e.g., MobileNet, TinyML) for mobile environments (iOS/Android), implement models with ≥3 mathematical optimization techniques (quantization, pruning, matrix decomposition) using TensorFlow Lite or PyTorch Mobile, and meet performance criteria (inference speed ≤100ms, model size ≤10MB)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
